Class Prim

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.Prim

    public class Prim
extends java.lang.Object
implements IMinimumSpanningTree
    Implementation of Prim's Algorithm using a Graph List Adjacent Representation.
    Author:
    Thiago Maia

    • Method Detail

      • search

        public IGraph search()
              throws IllegalGraphFormatException
        Description copied from interface: IMinimumSpanningTree
        Execute the Algorithm searching the Minimal Spanning Tree from the Graph.

        While the HeapMin is not Empty, I remove the vertex with minimum width from the HeapMin. If this vertex minimum is not a Font, I will add this edge from the result Graph.

        And executing the relaxation, a for each in all adjacent vertex from the source vertex removed in the HeapMin, if this adjacent vertex exist in the HeapMin and the edge width is less than adjacent vertex width, I will set the edge width value in adjacent width value and update then from HeapMin.

        Specified by:
        search in interface IMinimumSpanningTree
        Returns:
        The Graph result.
        Throws:
        IllegalGraphFormatException

      • getValueMST

        public int getValueMST()
        Specified by:
        getValueMST in interface IMinimumSpanningTree
        Returns:
        The sum of the all width edges the Minimal Spanning Tree result.

      • isMinimalSpanningTree

        public boolean isMinimalSpanningTree(IGraph subGraph)
                              throws IllegalGraphFormatException
        Description copied from interface: IMinimumSpanningTree
        1. If the number of vertex in this subGraph is different from the superGraph, throw an IllegalGraphFormatException.
        2. If the number of edge in this subGraph is 0(zero) or each edge is not a Bridge, throw an IllegalGraphFormatException.
        3. If this subGraph passed is disconnected, throw an IllegalGraphFormatException.

        4. Sum each edgeWidth from the subGraph edges and compare this sum with the sum resulted from the PRIM. If is equals, return True.
        Specified by:
        isMinimalSpanningTree in interface IMinimumSpanningTree
        Returns:
        Sum each edgeWidth from the subGraph edges and compare this sum with the sum resulted from the PRIM. If is equals, return True.
        Throws:
        IllegalGraphFormatException
